covered: PUT Valid Request: Happy-path updates (TC01, TC02) return 204 and persist changes
Partial Update: Partial input updates (TC19) and treatNullAsReset semantics (TC03/TC04)
Non-Existing Resource Handling: Update non-existent account (TC08) -> 400
Authorization / Authentication: Tests for missing header (TC05) and invalid/missing token (TC09)
Validation / Invalid Payload: Invalid data (TC07), invalid accountId (TC06), empty body (TC11), invalid formats (TC21), injection (TC18)
Edge/Boundary: Extra fields (TC10), extra query params (TC22)
Performance & Size: Large payload (TC13) and slow network (TC14)
gaps: Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for handling burst of PUT requests
Caching Behavior / Idempotency headers: No tests for ETag/Cache-Control with PUT
Authorization granularity: No test for 403 Forbidden vs 401 Unauthorized (only 401 in TC09)
Partial Update rejection case when not allowed: No explicit test for rejecting partial updates when API disallows them
Non-Existent Resource naming: 400 used; ensure consistency with 404 if policy dictates
recommendations: Add a test for 403 Forbidden scenario / insufficient permissions
Add rate limiting tests to ensure API handles multiple concurrent requests
Add tests around caching headers (ETag) and If-None-Match if applicable to PUT
Add explicit test for rejecting disallowed partial updates to confirm behavior
Consider aligning error codes for non-existent resources (400/404) with API contract and document expectations
